body_html:
I also encounter this error during cifar10_eval.py. (I am using the pip installed gpu version). The installation was a little dated.

Hopefully this is not TMI:

After a reinstall via pip, I started getting the conv1 weights uninitialized error during training.
#642

Think that perhaps the pip version is out of date, I decided to try to recompile from source.
Next, I did pip uninstall tensorflow to reinistall from source.
On a fresh clone, bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer terminated successfully with lots of repeated "info" outputs regarding Eigen::AlignedBit being deprecated.

Finally, I ran into the CUDA_ERROR_DEINITIALIZED segfault during bazel-bin/tensorflow/cc/tutorials_example_trainer --use_gpu
#723

body:
I also encounter this error during cifar10_eval.py. (I am using the pip installed gpu version). The installation was a little dated. 

Hopefully this is not TMI:

After a reinstall via pip, I started getting the conv1 weights uninitialized error during training.
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/642

Think that perhaps the pip version is out of date, I decided to try to recompile from source.
Next, I did `pip uninstall tensorflow` to reinistall from source. 
On a fresh clone, `bazel build -c opt --config=cuda //tensorflow/cc:tutorials_example_trainer` terminated successfully with lots of repeated "info" outputs regarding Eigen::AlignedBit  being deprecated.

Finally, I ran into the CUDA_ERROR_DEINITIALIZED segfault during `bazel-bin/tensorflow/cc/tutorials_example_trainer --use_gpu`
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/723
